subject: Design
title: Stained Glass: Light as Interior Design
description: A short lesson to help you apply Stained Glass: Light as Interior Design.

hook.text: Walk into a Gothic cathedral and colored light transforms the stone interior into something otherworldly.

buildup.text: Stained glass windows were designed to teach Bible stories to people who couldn't read.

discovery.text: The colored light was intentional design: blue for heaven, red for sacrifice, gold for divinity.

twist.text: Engineers had to invent flying buttresses â€” external supports â€” just to make walls thin enough for glass.

climax.text: Stained glass proved that light itself can be a design material, not just something to let in.

punchline.text: Medieval builders designed with light 800 years before LED mood lighting.

quiz.question: What was the primary purpose of stained glass windows in Gothic cathedrals?
options: Teaching Bible stories through visual design
